metadata.title: CVE-2022-2881 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
The underlying bug might cause read past end of the buffer and either read memory it should not read, or crash the process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
bind9-host - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
bind9-libs - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
bind9-utils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
bind9utils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
dnsutils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs mdeslaur> affects 9.18+

criterions.comment: bind9 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.18.4-2ubuntu2').
